table.name: encounters
table.column: Looking around you, there appear to be a few areas worth checking out.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
Open fields are scavengers' worst options, as anything of value here was likely already spotted and taken. Plus, there's hardly anywhere to hide.
But hey, beggars can't be choosers.

table.name: encounters
table.column:
As you approach the town, there is no sign of activity. Buildings stand in ruin. Vehicles are overturned and blackened with fire. Explosion marks radiate outward from walls and pavement.
In the d istance, strange-looking creatures circle in the sky, like monstrous, leathery vultures.
The worl d has drastically changed from what you knew. Some sort of cataclysm has befallen Earth, returning mankind to the dark ages.
And alon g with it, your hopes of finding a warm meal and some answers. You decide to look around, and scavenge what you can from the ruins.

table.name: encounters
table.column: "Is there anything else we can help you with?"

table.name: encounters
table.column:
"...was at the fifty-five by the two-oh." He stops speaking into a radio, disappointed at the interruption.
"Wh at you need?"

table.name: encounters
table.column:
You're standing in the Anishinaabe Tribal Nation's gathering area, by the Great Fire.
Around you, you see an area where people are sharing a meal together, and a trader of goods.
Further away, you see a cluster of huts near a sweat lodge, where Joe, the Nooke Midewinini, tends to the sick and wounded.
On the opposite side lies a small open field close to several huts, which serves as a training area.
